description: This notification is sent by the agent when the
controller detects that the AP couldn't apply the
protection configuration to the specific radio
interface for the specified WLAN. The controller
detects the mismatch by matching the MFP configuration
requested to be applied with the configuration
returned in the acknowledgement as having been applied
to the radio interface. The controller also
generates this notification to indicate that
configuration mismatch is cleared when the
values of cLMfpProtectionEnable and
cLMfpApIfMfpProtectionActual are found to be the
same.
This notification is generated by the controller
only if MFP has been configured as the protection
mechanism through cLMfpProtectType.

event.Summary: AP $v6 couldn't apply the protection configuration to the specific radio interface on WLAN Index $v3.

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::ciscoLwappMfpProtectConfigMismatch CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLApMacAddress s 01:01:01:01:01:01 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLApDot11IfSlotIdx u 9999 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLWlanIdx u 9999 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpProtectionEnable i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpApIfMfpProtectionActual i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApName s EXAMPLE

description: This notification is sent by the agent when the
controller detects that the AP couldn't configure
itself with the MFP signature validation
configuration. The controller detects the mismatch by
matching the MFP configuration requested to be applied
with the configuration returned in the acknowledgement
as having been configured by the AP. The controller
also generates this notification to indicate that
configuration mismatch is cleared when the values
of cLMfpApMfpValidationEnable and
cLMfpApMfpValidationActual are found to be the same.
This notification is generated by the controller
only if MFP has been configured as the protection
mechanism through cLMfpProtectType.

Summary.eval: ($v2 == $v3) ? 'AP has configured itself with the MFP signature validation config.' : 'AP could not configure itself with the MFP signature validation config.'

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::ciscoLwappMfpValidationConfigMismatch CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLApMacAddress s 01:01:01:01:01:01 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpApMfpValidationEnable i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpApMfpValidationActual i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApName s EXAMPLE

description: This notification is sent by the agent to indicate
the controller's status of synchronization of its
timebase with that of a central timebase. The
notification is sent once after the controller comes
up and thereafter, it is sent everytime the
status changes.

event.Summary: Controller's timebase sync status with the central timebase: $v1

description: This notification is sent by the agent when the
MFP configuration of the WLAN was violated by the
radio interface cLApIfSmtDot11Bssid and detected by
the radio interface cLApDot11IfSlotId of the AP
cLApMacAddress. The violation is indicated by
cLMfpEventType.
Through this notification, the controller reports
the NMS the occurrence of a total of cLMfpEventTotal
volation events, of type cLMfpEventType, upon
observing the management frame(s) indicated by
cLMfpEventFrames for the last cLMfpEventPeriod
time units. When cLMfpEventTotal is 0, it
indicates that no further anomalies have recently
been detected and that the NMS should clear any
alarm raised about the MFP errors.
This notification is generated by the controller
only if MFP has been configured as the protection
mechanism through cLMfpProtectType.

event.Summary: Radio interface $v2 on AP $v1 has detected violation $v4 in MFP configuration of WLAN on radio interface $v3.

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::ciscoLwappMfpAnomalyDetected CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLApMacAddress s 01:01:01:01:01:01 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLApDot11IfSlotIdx u 9999 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApIfSmtDot11Bssid s EXAMPL CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpEventType i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpEventTotal u 9999 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpEventPeriod i 9999 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpEventFrames b 1

description: This notification is sent by the agent when the
MFP configuration of the WLAN was violated by the
radio interface cLApIfSmtDot11Bssid and detected by
the radio interface cLApDot11IfSlotId of the AP
cLApMacAddress. The violation is indicated by
cLMfpEventType.
Through this notification, the controller reports
the NMS the occurrence of a total of cLMfpEventTotal
volation events, of type cLMfpEventType, upon
observing the management frame(s) indicated by
cLMfpEventFrames for the last cLMfpEventPeriod
time units. When cLMfpEventTotal is 0, it
indicates that no further anomalies have recently
been detected and that the NMS should clear any
alarm raised about the MFP errors.
cLClientLastSourceMacAddress is used only when the
controller generates notifications about client-related
attacks. The controller will populate zeros as the value
for cLClientLastSourceMacAddress when reporting anomalies
sourced by infrastructure devices.
This notification is generated by the controller
only if MFP has been configured as the protection
mechanism through cLMfpProtectType.

event.Summary: Radio interface $v2 has on AP $v9 detected violation $v4 in MFP configuration of WLAN on radio interface $v3.

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::ciscoLwappMfpAnomalyDetected1 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLApMacAddress s 01:01:01:01:01:01 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLApDot11IfSlotIdx u 9999 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApIfSmtDot11Bssid s EXAMPL CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpEventType i 1 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpEventTotal u 9999 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpEventPeriod i 9999 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLMfpEventFrames b 1 CISCO-LWAPP-MFP-MIB::cLClientLastSourceMacAddress s 01:01:01:01:01:01 CISCO-LWAPP-AP-MIB::cLApName s EXAMPLE
